intro: Achyronia calcarata, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, often found in coastal and desert regions. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Achyronia calcarata is known for its drought tolerance and ability to stabilize sandy soils, making it an important plant in ecological restoration projects.
